task_summary: Detect the grape, approach with a pre-grasp above it, align, gently close the gripper to grasp, confirm grasp, and retreat with the grape.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 end-effector must pick a grape positioned near a reflective round plate on a tabletop. The robot first ensures visual detection, then moves to a safe pre-grasp height and computes a pinch grasp pose. It opens, aligns precisely, lowers until contact, closes with low force, and executes a pick. After verifying a stable grasp, it retreats upward to clear the workspace. The contact sheet shows progressive approach, alignment over the grape, closure, and lift-off.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for plate and grape
Robot reachable workspace includes the grape
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the grape target.
Move to a pre-grasp pose above the grape.
Compute a pinch grasp and verify pose availability.
Open gripper; align to grasp pose precisely.
Lower until contact and close with low force.
Execute pick, check stability and object presence.
Retreat upward to secure the grasp.
success_criteria: Robot retreats to a safe distance without collision
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, scan and retry up to three times.
If alignment fails, reopen and recompute grasp.
If grasp unstable, reopen, re-approach, and re-grasp.
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends after successful retreat with ObjectInGripper==true and IsGraspStable==true.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector centered above target region indicating alignment verification.
frame_3.predicts_next: Descent and grasp closure should follow.

node_specs.description: Run perception to detect the grape.
Active scan if the grape is not immediately visible.
Check current visibility of the grape.
Move to a safe pre-grasp height above the grape.
Compute a pinch grasp pose and store it to blackboard.
Ensure the grasp pose key exists.
Align end-effector with the computed grasp pose.
Close gripper with low force to grasp the grape.
Execute pick routine using the computed grasp.
Retreat to a safe height with the object.

recovery_strategy: Reopen and re-grasp with corrected pose
Increase pre-grasp height and retry lowering
assumptions: The dark cluster near the round plate represents the grape; frames suggest approach, alignment, closure, and lift. No explicit placing is required by the instruction.
